about.footer_text: The service is provided by Sikt — Norwegian Agency for Shared Services in Education and Research. Sikt provides shared services to the Norwegian knowledge sector.

authorization.about_terms: Terms of Use and Privacy Policy for the Norwegian Research Information Repository
authorization.about_terms_description:
To use the service, you must accept Sikt's Terms of Use for the Norwegian Research Information Repository, and familiarize yourself with the Privacy Policy for the Norwegian Research Information Repository.

By clicking on «$t(authorization.accept)», you confirm that you have read and accepted the terms of use. You also consent to the processing of personal data in accordance with the privacy policy.
authorization.accept_terms_intro:
Thank you for wanting to make research openly available in the Norwegian Research Information Repository.

This helps ensure that research is documented and that scientific articles funded by public resources are made openly available to the public — which is a national goal.
authorization.accept_terms_to_create_user: I consent to being created as a user in NVA
authorization.cancel_create_user_text: You must create a user to proceed. If you cancel, you will be logged out. Do you wish to cancel?
authorization.create_user_info: As a user, you will be available to anyone who wants to add an author or contributor to results.
authorization.expired_token_info: Your session has expired and you have been logged out. Continue as an anonymous user or log in again.
authorization.forbidden_description:
You do not have access to view the content on this page.

If you want to access the page you need to log in.
authorization.forbidden_description_logged_in: Contact administrator if this is incorrect.
authorization.registration_not_published: This registration has not been published yet.

add_employee.have_you_informed: Have you informed them that personal information is being added in NVA?
add_employee.have_you_informed_confirmation_text: Have you informed the person that personal information about them is being added in NVA?
add_employee.have_you_informed_description: <0>By creating the person in NVA, you confirm that you have a legal basis to enter the personal data on behalf of this person.</0><0>Before the person is created in NVA, we need you to confirm that the person has been informed that personal data about them is being entered in NVA.</0>
add_employee.missing_nin_description: <0>We need you to confirm the identity of the person without a national identity number such as a birth number or D-number.</0><0>To distinguish the person from others with similar names, at least one research result associated with this person must be registered.</0><0>Note that you are not only confirming the person for your institution, but also for other institutions in the system.</0><0>Whoever confirms the exception will therefore be visible in the system as documentation.</0><0>Do you confirm that this person exists and has contributed to at least one research result at your institution?</0>
add_employee.missing_nin_title: Confirm identity for person without national identity number
add_employee.no_matching_persons_found: If you can't find the correct person in the Person Registry, you can create a new person profile.
add_employee.only_confirmed_user_qualify_for_nvi: Only persons with confirmed identity can be included in the NVI report.

merge_candidate.merge_details_2: Data from NVA is displayed on the right. Metadata from the import candidate is displayed on the left and often has better data quality. You can individually select what you want to include.

doi.doi_information_bullet_points: $t(common.doi_long) is a persistent identifier.|Simplifies citations of publications.|Metadata about the result is shared internationally.|Visiblity of result increases.|Contributes to fulfill the FAIR principles.|Supports open research.
doi.doi_information_bullet_points_2: The service has support for assigning $t(common.doi_long) to results.|The institution that assigns $t(common.doi_long) becomes the publisher of the result.|Thorough checking of metadata, contents of files and licences is necessary before assigning $t(common.doi_long). Incorrect metadata is time-consuming to correct afterwards.
doi.institution_can_create_doi: The institution has a profile with DataCite that gives the Curator access to assign $t(common.doi_long) to the result.
doi.institution_cannot_create_doi: Contact <0>Sikt</0> if your institution wants to assign $t(common.doi_long).

institution.change_institution_support: Change user support point of contact

channel_claims.add_publisher_channel_claim_description:
The institution will be designated as responsible for the result and may receive inquiries via the support point specified as the institution's user support.

By assigning ownership to the publisher, publication requests are sent to the specified institution regardless of whether the registrant belongs to another institution.
channel_claims.add_serial_publication_channel_claim_des:
The institution will be designated as responsible for the result and may receive inquiries via the support point specified as the institution's user support.

By assigning ownership to the series/journal, publication requests are sent to the specified institution regardless of whether the registrant belongs to another institution.
channel_claims.administer_publisher_channel_claim_descr: On this page, you manage ownership of publishers registered in the Channel Register.
channel_claims.administer_serial_publication_channel_cl: On this page, you manage ownership of series/journals registered in the Channel Register.
channel_claims.category_limitations_helper_text:
Access restrictions may apply to all result categories or only selected categories.

Publication Requests

For result categories WITH access restrictions, publication requests are sent to the file curator at the channel owner.

For result categories WITHOUT access restrictions, publication requests are sent to the file curator at the institution where the registrant is logged in.
channel_claims.channel_claims_settings_description: Administer ownership and access to channels from the Channel registry:
channel_claims.channel_owner_helper_text:
The institution that has taken the editorial responsibility for content published by the channel.

If a channel has the wrong editor, contact Sikt to correct the error: .
channel_claims.claim_category_restriction: Categories the limitation should apply to
channel_claims.delete_channel_claim_description: Are you sure you want to remove ownership to {{name}}?
channel_claims.editing_access_helper_text:
All Institutions

Employees at other institutions can edit results published on the owner institution's channel.

Curators at other institutions can edit and delete files that have already been approved. For newly uploaded files, publication requests are sent to the curator at the owner institution.

Only Owner Institution

Only employees at the owner institution can edit results published on the publication channel.

Registrants and curators not logged in at the owner institution cannot edit metadata on the result after the uploaded files have been approved.
channel_claims.register_access_helper_text:
All Institutions

Registrants from other institutions can register results published on the institution's channels. Publication requests are sent to the file curator at the owner institution.

Only Owner Institution

Only employees at the owner institution can register results published on the publication channel.

Registrants not logged in at the owner institution will receive an error message if they select one of the publication channels and will be instructed to contact support.

institution.institution_is_nvi_institution: The institution reports to the Norwegian Science Index

institution.rbo_funded: The institution receives funding via Performance based funding allocation (RBO)

publish_strategy.registrator_publishes_metadata_descripti: Files and licences must be approved by the Curator before they become publicly available.
publish_strategy.registrator_publishes_without_curator: The registrar publishes without approval from Curator
publish_strategy.registrator_publishes_without_curator_de: The institution determines who is the Registrar.

retention_strategy.creator_can_override_rrs_text: <0>The institution has made it possible for the registrar to choose not to follow the institution's rights retention strategy (RRS). By following a rights retention strategy (RRS), scientific articles become openly available immediately without embargo. <0>See cOAlition S's website for information on RRS and Plan S.</0></0> <1>In NVA, the registrar removes RRS from the accepted version of the file in the registration of a scientific article. The RRS checkbox appears by clicking on the arrow icon under the accepted version of the file. By removing the check from RRS, the selected licence on the file is removed and the licence must be selected again.</1>
retention_strategy.curator_can_override_rrs_text: <0>The file curator has access to set that files do not follow the institution's rights retention strategy (RRS).</0> <0>If the registrar does not wish to follow the institution's rights retention strategy (RRS), look at the terms for not following RRS on the information page about the institution's rights retention strategy.</0> <1>By following a rights retention strategy (RRS), scientific articles become openly available immediately without embargo. <0>See cOAlition S's website for information on RRS and Plan S</0>.</1>
retention_strategy.customer_has_no_rrs: <0>The institution has not provided a rights retention strategy (RRS) in NVA.</0> <0>Without an institutional rights retention strategy, it is up to the registrar to set the correct licence on the accepted version of files in the registration of scientific articles.</0> <1>It is up to the registrar to potentially mark whether the publication should follow an RRS. By following a rights retention strategy (RRS), scientific articles become openly available immediately without embargo. <0>See cOAlition S's website for information on RRS and Plan S.</0></1> <0>If the publication is funded by an actor that requires adherence to RRS (ref. Plan S), then RRS must be set. In NVA, the registrar sets RRS on the accepted version of the file in the registration of a scientific article. The RRS checkbox appears by clicking on the arrow icon under the accepted version of the file. By checking the box for RRS, the licence for the file is set to CC-BY.</0>
retention_strategy.customer_has_rrs_text: <0>The institution has provided a rights retention strategy (RRS) in NVA.</0> <0>The CC-BY licence is set when you choose the accepted version of the file in the registration of a scientific article in NVA.</0>
retention_strategy.possible_not_to_follow_rrs: Possible to not follow the institution's rights retention policy
retention_strategy.rrs_info_page: The institutions' information page about rights retention policy

file_upload_disabled_curator_can_upload_: Your institution does not allow the registrar to upload files for this category. As curator, you may add a file on behalf of the registrar.
file_upload_disabled_due_to_institution_: Your institution does not allow the registrar to upload files for this category. Contact curator support if you wish to have a file on this result.
find_result_to_merge_description:
Merge two results to avoid having two versions of the same result with different metadata and files.

If different metadata is registered, you can choose which data will apply. You also decide whether files should be transferred to the published result.

Search for research result

Select the result you want to merge with. You can only merge results where you are registered as a contributor.

footer.about_nva: About The Norwegian Research Information Repository (NVA)
footer.about_nva_text: The Norwegian Research Information Repository (NVA) collects publications and other research results, and makes them openly available in a common national solution. This makes results from Norwegian research available in a single service.
footer.about_sikt_text: Sikt enters into an agreement with each institution about the use of the service. Our customers are typically universities, colleges, research institutes and organizations in the health sector.
footer.technical_support_link: If you need technical support, please contact <0>kontakt@sikt.no</0>

description.cc0:
The work is released for public use, without copyright, as far as the law allows.

If this licence is used, upload a document explaining why.
description.cc_by:
The user may: copy, share, and modify the work for all types of use, including commercial.

The user must: provide appropriate credit and indicate changes.
description.cc_by_nc:
The user may: copy, share, and modify the work, but only for non-commercial purposes.

The user must: provide appropriate credit and indicate changes.
description.cc_by_nc_nd:
The user may: copy and share the work for non-commercial purposes.

The user may not: modify or adapt the work.

The user must: provide appropriate credit.
description.cc_by_nc_sa:
The user may: copy, share, and modify the work for non-commercial purposes.

The user must: provide appropriate credit, indicate changes, and use the same licence for the new work.
description.cc_by_nd:
The user may: copy and share the work for all types of use, including commercial.

The user may not: modify or adapt the work.

The user must: provide appropriate credit.
description.cc_by_sa:
The user may: copy, share, and modify the work for all types of use, including commercial.

The user must: provide appropriate credit, indicate changes, and use the same licence for the new work.
description.copyright_act:
This material can only be used within the framework provided by the Copyright Act (Intellectual Property Rights Act).

  • The user is permitted to read and link to the material.
  • The user may quote from the material in accordance with fair practice and to the extent required by the purpose.
  • The user may copy the material for private use, including sharing within a private circle and for personal professional use.

If the user wishes to utilize the material in another manner, for example, for re-publication, they must obtain consent directly from the rights holder (the individual or legal entity owning the intellectual property rights to the material).
description.older_licenses: If you need to register an older research result that was published with a previous licence version, click on "Show all previous versions" in the dropdown menu to find the correct licence

licenses.terms_of_use_under_the_copyright_act:
$t(licenses.labels.copyright_act)

These terms of use describe the lawful use of material made available in the Norwegian Research Information Repository (NVA) and labelled with "general terms of use".

  • You are free to read and link to the material.
    • You are free to read the material and share links to it, for example in an email or on a website.
  • You may quote from the material in accordance with fair practice and to the extent required by the purpose, cf. Copyright Act § 29.
    • The quote must be placed in a relevant context and must not alter the character of the work.
    • Always provide the source and author, as far as it is practically possible, cf. § 5.
  • You may make copies for private use, including sharing within a close circle of acquaintances and for personal professional use. By "private use," it is meant that the copy should only be used in a limited circle or by yourself, and therefore not shared with the public or used commercially. This could, for example, include:
    • Private use: for example, downloading an article to later use or share it with a friend or family member.
    • Private professional use: for example, downloading an article to prepare a lecture or taking a document home for self-study.
When do you need permission?

If you wish to use the material in another way — for example, publish it elsewhere, use it in new publications, or make the entire work available outside NVA — you must obtain permission from the rights holder. Such actions are covered by the author's exclusive rights under Copyright Act § 3.

Are you in doubt?

If you are unsure whether you have the right to use the material as you intend, it is recommended to contact the rights holder — or your institution for guidance.

If you are the rights holder of an intellectual property work that has been given this licence and you disagree that the material can be used as described above, you must contact the publisher (the institution or journal) that has published it.

If it is not possible to contact the publisher, you can contact the service provider for NVA, Sikt: Inquiries about copyright.

my_profile.background_description: <0>It is voluntary to fill out the information in the fields below.</0><0>You can withdraw your consent at any time by deleting the text from the fields.</0><0>By filling out the information in the fields below, you consent to it being added to your public profile in the Norwegian Research Information Repository. Your profile is publicly visible to anyone using the Norwegian Research Information Repository.</0><0>Do not provide sensitive personal data in the fields as this will be visible on your public profile.</0>

my_profile.name: Name
my_profile.name_description: Person name are retrieved from the login.

helper_text_modal.detailed_paragraph_1: If you have an ORCID, you are encouraged to link it to your researcher profile. If you do not have an ORCID, you can create it at the same time as you link it to your researcher profile.
helper_text_modal.detailed_paragraph_2: Some publishers and funders require you to have an ORCID, in order to submit manuscripts and applications for funding respectively. If they do not require it, you as a researcher should demand it. Your research results will become easier for everyone to cite correctly and there is less work afterwards. Linking ORCID to your researcher profile is an offer, not a requirement. You can withdraw your link whenever you want under "$t(my_page.my_page)" > "Personal information".
helper_text_modal.introduction: ORCID provides you with a permanent, digital identifier that you own and control, distinguishing you from other researchers. By linking your ORCID to your researcher profile, the NVA will be able to import more of your publications in the future, faster and more accurately.
helper_text_modal.link: For more information go to ORCID

orcid.orcid_description: If you link your ORCID, it will be easier to identify you
orcid.remove_connection_info:
Are you sure you want to remove the link to ORCID?

If you wish to revoke Sikt's approval to read your ORCID, please go to your ORCID profile.

my_profile.orcid_is_voluntary: <0>It is optional to connect ORCID to your profile in NVA. With ORCID it is easier for others to identify you.</0><0>You own and control your ORCID. You may at any time connect or disconnect your ORCID to you profile in NVA.</0>
my_profile.remove_profile_picture_info: Are you sure you want to remove the profile picture?
my_profile.terms_description: <0>You have accepted <0>Sikt's User Terms<0></0></0>.</0><0>Sikt's User Terms for the Norwegian Research Information Repository include, among other things, that if you enter personal data about other people, you must have their permission or another legal basis. You must ensure that the person concerned is informed that their personal data is published in the Norwegian Research Information Repository.</0><0>You cannot make available/upload copyrighted material/works of art without having permission from all authors.</0><0>You are responsible for ensuring that your use of the Norwegian Research Information Repository is not in violation of applicable law.</0><0>For more information, see the <0>Sikt's User Terms<0></0></0> in their entirety.</0>
my_profile.upload_description: <0>By uploading a picture you consent to having the picture added as a profile picture on your public profile in the Norwegian Research Information Repository.</0><0>The profile picture is publicly visible to anyone who uses the Norwegian Research Information Repository.</0>
my_profile.upload_is_not_mandatory: <0>Uploading a picture is optional.</0><0>You may at any time withdraw your consent by deleting the picture.</0>

no_search_results_list_default:
Suggestions for search:

  • Remove one or more limitations in the search
  • Check that your search words are spelled correctly
  • Try a different spelling
  • Try a synonym
  • Translate the search word to Norwegian Bokmål (NB), Norwegian Nynorsk (NN), or English

Suggestions for search:

  • Remove one or more limitations in the search
  • Check that the name is spelled correctly
  • Try a different spelling
  • Try with or without the middle name

contributors.identify_contributor_description:
Select the correct person from the results list to change to an identified contributor.

Click on the circle in front of the person's name to add them with all registered institutional affiliations, or the box in front of an institutional address to add the person with that affiliation.

If you do not get a hit on a person who credits your institution, contact the administrator so they can register them.

Pre-filled name: {{name}}
contributors.invalid_role: The contributor must have a role that is valid for this resource type to be shown to other users
contributors.must_select_type_first: You must select a category before you can add contributors.

description.add_project_helper_text: Search for and select the project in the search field to link the result to a project that is already registered in NVA.
description.confirm_remove_vocabulary_text: Are you sure you want to remove vocabulary for {{vocabulary}}?
description.create_project_helper_text: <0>The researcher defines their own projects.</0> <0>A project must have a title, a project manager, a coordinating institution, a start and an end date. A project can have project participants, funders, approvals or research results.</0> <0>If you have an RCN funding, you can establish a project with that as a starting point. You start by looking up your RCN funding, it is added to the project and all mandatory fields are pre-filled, except for the project manager who must be looked up and confirmed.</0> <0>(Similar functionality is planned based on a REC approval. All projects that are to be part of the KBS reporting must have a REC approval that identifies the project as a clinical treatment study.)</0>
description.duplicate_publication_date_warning: There is already a publication with the same title that has been published this year
description.duplicate_title_warning: There is a registration in NVA with the same title. Please cancel the registration if it is the same result that you are trying to register, to avoid creating a duplicate.

funding.funding_helper_text: <0>You can register funding directly on the result. This is particularly relevant if you do not know which project the result is part of, or if the result has other funders than the project it may belong to.</0> <0>If the result is linked to a project, it will inherit all project funding. It is not necessary to enter the same funding twice.</0>
funding.funding_without_project_description: <0>If the research receives funding not associated with a project, then click on "Add funding" and then search for the funder.</0> <0>Do not register funding that is associated with a project. Funding associated with a project is added when you add the project further up the page. If the funding information does not appear, this must be registered to the project in NVA.</0>
funding.nfr_project_search: Search by project name or project manager

description.keywords_helper: Separate keywords with commas or enter
description.npi_disciplines: Scientific field in the Norwegian Publication Indicator
description.project_helper_text: <0>If you register a funding source on a project, the results you link to that project will "inherit" information about funding. This means you don't have to register all funding sources on all the results of the project. If you search for the funding source in NVA, you will get hits on both the project and the results, and reporting to the Research Council or others will include all results.</0> <0>A result can be linked to several projects.</0>

files_and_license.delete_file_description: Do you wish to delete {{fileName}}? Note that the file will be permanently deleted as soon as you confirm.
files_and_license.disabled_helper_text: This file is already published with an approved licence. Contact the curator if you wish to edit or delete the file
files_and_license.file_and_license_info:
The licence informs readers how they can reuse the work in their own work.

Creative Commons (CC) defines 6 standardized licence types with varying degrees of freedom and one licence where the creator waives all rights.

Read more about Creative Commons licences for comprehensive information about rights and obligations in each of the licences.
files_and_license.file_helper_text_metadata_and_files: Your institution has given you access to publish. You must check that you are allowed to publish the files you have uploaded, and that the selected licence is correct. If you need help, click the button {{buttonText}} at the bottom of the page.
files_and_license.file_helper_text_point_list:
• Select "open file" for documents that should be made publicly available.
  • Select "internal file" for documents that should be shared with the curator.
files_and_license.file_publish_date_helper_text: The file is locked until the specified date
files_and_license.files_awaits_approval_one: {{count}} file and selected licence are waiting to be verified
files_and_license.files_awaits_approval_other: {{count}} files and selected licences are waiting to be verified
files_and_license.files_helper_text: Here you can upload the full text of the publication and other documents as supplements and appendices.
files_and_license.files_helper_text_metadata_only: A curator will review the files and ensure that only the files you are allowed to share are shared, and that they are assigned the correct licence.
files_and_license.files_helper_text_paragraph_2: You can upload document(s) that specify the requirements for publication, such as which version you can make public, the licence, and any date for delayed availability (embargo). For example, the author agreement made with the publisher is helpful when the curator checks if and when the file can be made public in NVA.
files_and_license.find_journal_in_channel_register: See information about the journal in the Norwegian Register
files_and_license.find_publisher_in_channel_register: See information about the publisher in the Norwegian Register
files_and_license.find_series_in_channel_register: See information about the series in the Norwegian Register
files_and_license.follow_institution_rights_policy: I wish to follow the <0>rights policy</0> of my institution.
files_and_license.info_from_channel_register: More information about the selected publication channel
files_and_license.institution_prefers_cc_by: Your institution has a <0>rights policy</0> that recommends CC-BY.
files_and_license.institution_rights_policy_opt_out_instru: If you wish to opt out of the institution's rights policy, you must check if this is possible at your institution. Contact curator support.
files_and_license.mark_if_funder_requires_rrs: If this publication is funded by an actor who requires you to follow RRS (ref. Plan S), then you indicate that here.
files_and_license.no_duplicates: Cannot add "{{fileName}}", because a file with the same name already exists
files_and_license.no_files_or_links_present_in_this_regist: No file or link has been added for the registration
files_and_license.opted_out_of_rrs: You have chosen not to follow the adopted <0>rights policy</0>
files_and_license.resource_has_no_files_or_links: The resource does not have any files or links to publish
files_and_license.resource_is_a_reference: The resource is a reference and has no files or links to publish
files_and_license.version_helper_text:
Upload the accepted version if the published version is not openly published with a Creative Commons licence.

Accepted Version (Authors Accepted Manuscript, AAM)

Author's final version after peer review, as submitted to the publisher. This version does not have the publisher's pagination and graphic style or any editorial rewrites that the published version includes.

Published Version (Version of Records, VOR)

The article as presented in a journal, in print and/or online. This version will include editorial improvements and the publisher's graphic profile. Usually available on a publisher's website, in PDF format. The publisher has determined the licence, and you must choose the same one with which the article is published.

registration.locked_nvi_field_description: The publication has been approved for this year's NVI reporting. Therefore, you cannot change {{field}}. If the information is incorrect, you must contact the curator to have it changed.
registration.modal_unsaved_changes_description: You have unsaved changes. Are you sure you want to leave this page?

nvi_warning.approval_override_warning: You have changed the publication in such a way that all institutions with co-authors must approve it again to get it included in this year's NVI report.
nvi_warning.confirm_saving_registration: Do you want to save your changes?
nvi_warning.continue_editing_registration: Do you still want to edit the publication?
nvi_warning.registration_is_included_in_nvi: The publication is part of the Norwegian Science Index (NVI)
nvi_warning.reset_nvi_warning: You may change the year, contributors' affiliation(s) to institution(s), category, or publication channel, but curators at all participating institutions must re-approve the publication for the Norwegian Science Index (NVI).

duplicate_warning_modal.check_duplicate: You should not create duplicates in NVA. Check if <0>this publication <0></0></0> is the same result that you have registered.
duplicate_warning_modal.confirm_not_duplicate: Can you confirm that this is not a duplicate?
duplicate_warning_modal.contact_registrator_to_change: If there are errors or omissions in the publication that is registered, you must contact the registrar or contributor in the registration to change it. You cannot publish the same result again in NVA.
duplicate_warning_modal.headline: The result could be a duplicate
duplicate_warning_modal.if_same_press_no_in_box: If this is the same result as your registration, you must press 'NO' in this box to avoid publishing.
duplicate_warning_modal.publication_already_exists: There is already a publication with the same title and year as your registration.

public_page.error_description_published_result_workf: The registration is published. The following deficiencies must be corrected when editing:
The registration is published, but lacks the following:
public_page.error_description_workflow1: The following errors must be corrected before publishing the result:
public_page.find_in_channel_registry: Find in the Norwegian register for publishers
public_page.no_public_files: The result has no public files.
public_page.preview_unavailable: Preview not available. Open the file in a suitable program.
public_page.publishing_request_message_about:
If you have questions, contact the curator via the message field.

The message is visible to all editors and curators connected to the result in NVA.
public_page.publishing_request_message_about_curator: If you need clarification, contact the registrar via the message field.
public_page.reject_publish_request_description: <0>Please provide a reason for why the file(s) are being rejected for publication.</0><0>This reason will be stored in NVA and visible to both the registrar and contributors who are associated with the research result.</0><0>When you reject the file(s), they are removed from the presentation page of the research result. You and the registrar can publish them later or delete them by editing the research result.</0>
public_page.request_doi_again: Request a new assessment of DOI allocation.
public_page.request_doi_description: <0>Allocation of a DOI (Digital Object Identifier) means that metadata about the research result is shared internationally; therefore, a curator will review the registration before the DOI is allocated.</0><0>You can attach a message to the curator here.</0>

tasks_panel.approve_publishing_request_description:
<0>As a curator, you can approve or reject the uploaded files.</0><0>
If you click on "$t(registration.public_page.approve_publish_request)" in this menu, all uploaded files will be approved with their current settings. This means that open files will be published in NVA and internal files will be archived and hidden.</0>
tasks_panel.approved_publishing_request_description_: <0>Open files have been published in NVA and internal files have been archived and hidden.</0><0>The registrar can change the metadata, but not files that the curator has approved.</0><0>If the registrar uploads new files, or requests a new assessment of rejected files, a new publication request will be sent to the curator.</0>

<0>File(s) have been checked and approved by the curator. Open files have been published in NVA and internal files have been archived and hidden.</0><0>You are free to change the description of the result (metadata). New files that you upload must be sent to the curator for approval.</0><0>If you wish to change or delete files that have already been approved, please contact the curator via the message field.</0>

<0>The description of the result is published and visible to others. Any open files have been made public in NVA and internal files have been archived and hidden.</0><0>You are free to change the file(s) and description of the result (metadata).</0><0>If you wish to unpublish the research result, open more options at the bottom of this menu.</0>
tasks_panel.approved_publishing_request_without_file: <0>The registrar can change the metadata.</0><0>If the registrar uploads new files, or requests a new assessment of rejected files, a new publication request will be sent to the curator.</0>
<0>You are free to change the description of the result (metadata). New files that you upload must be sent to the curator for approval.</0>
tasks_panel.assign_doi_about: In order for others to be able to use the DOI, you must assign it. Metadata must be published.
tasks_panel.confirm_republish_description: Republish the result if it is to be available in NVA. This will cause the result to appear in search results again.
tasks_panel.delete_draft_description: If you wish to delete the entire registration, open more options at the bottom of this menu.
tasks_panel.delete_draft_registration_description: <0>If you delete the registration, it is permanently deleted.</0><0>It is not possible to restore information that is registered, including files, afterwards.</0>
tasks_panel.describe_doi_rejection_reason: You must justify the rejection of the request for a DOI on this research result.
tasks_panel.draft_doi_description: <0>A reserved DOI allows you (and those you share the DOI with) to cite the research result in other work before it is published.</0><1><0>Read more about DOI<0></0></0></1><0>If you want a DOI for this result, click on "{{buttonText}}".</0>
tasks_panel.duplicate_title_description_details: <0>Duplicates should not be created in NVA. Check if the result that has already been published is the same as the result you have registered.</0><0>If the result that is published has errors or omissions, ask the registrar or contributor associated with the result to change it. Do not register and publish a new result with the change as both results will be available in NVA.</0>
tasks_panel.duplicate_title_description_introduction: This registration has the same title and year as this publication:
tasks_panel.edit_publishing_request_description: To change the visibility of one or more files, click on "$t(registration.edit_registration)" and select a different status from the dropdown menu under the heading "$t(registration.files_and_license.availability)" for the file in question.
tasks_panel.files_will_soon_be_deleted: File(s) will be deleted. Wait a second before you refresh the page to see updated status.
tasks_panel.files_will_soon_be_published: The files will be available for others shortly. Wait a bit before you reload the page to see the status.
tasks_panel.files_will_soon_be_rejected: File(s) will be marked as rejected. Wait a little before you refresh the page to see the updated status.
tasks_panel.fix_validation_errors_before_republishin: You must fix all validation errors before you can republish.
tasks_panel.has_rejected_files_publishing_request: <0>The files are not deleted but hidden from the result view.</0><0>You will receive a new task if the registrar requests a new assessment of a rejected file or wants to approve a newly uploaded file.</0><0>To delete files permanently, edit the registration and remove the file.</0><0>If you want to unpublish the entire result, open more options at the bottom of this menu.</0>
tasks_panel.has_rejected_files_publishing_request_re: <0>The curator has rejected file(s), and they have been removed from the presentation page of the result. You can find the reason for the rejection in the message field of this menu.</0><0>If you wish to delete one or more files, press "$t(registration.edit_registration)" and remove the files there.</0><0>If you disagree with the rejection, change the status of the file(s) under "$t(registration.files_and_license.availability)" from "Rejected" to new status. The file will then be sent to the curator for new approval. Feel free to include a reason for the curator in the message field.</0>
tasks_panel.has_reserved_doi: <0>You can share the reserved DOI with those who will cite the result. Lookup via DOI is not possible until the DOI is assigned by the curator.</0><0>The DOI request is sent to the curator when the result is published. You publish the registration in the publishing menu.</0>
tasks_panel.move_task_description:
A publishing request has been sent to your area of responsibility because the registrant who uploaded the file is employed at this unit.

Move the task if the files should be handled by a curator at another institution or unit within your institution.
tasks_panel.move_task_dialog_description: Select the right institution from the list of credited institutions
tasks_panel.no_access_to_republish: <0>Should the result not have been unpublished</0><0>Contact the editor to have the result republished.</0>
tasks_panel.no_published_files_on_registration: No published files on the result
tasks_panel.no_published_files_on_registration_descr: <0>The result has no published files.</0><0>Check with the registrar if it is correct that the result should not have published files in NVA.</0><0>Do you want to assign a DOI to a result without a file?</0>
tasks_panel.pending_publishing_request_with_file_des: <0>The description of the result (metadata) is published and visible to others. The curator must check the files before they are published or archived in NVA.</0><0>You will be notified when the curator has approved the files you have uploaded. Open files will then be visible in NVA, while internal files will be archived and hidden.</0><0>You cannot change or delete files after the curator has approved their registration. Please contact the curator in the message field if you need to make changes.</0><0>If you wish to unpublish the entire result, open more options at the bottom of this menu.</0>
tasks_panel.pending_publishing_request_without_file_: <0>The description of the result (metadata) is published and visible to others.</0><0>If you wish to unpublish the entire result, open more options at the bottom of this menu.</0>
tasks_panel.publish_registration_description_workflo: <0>Review the draft before you publish.</0><0>The description (metadata) of the research results and any uploaded open files will be made public when you select "$t(registration.public_page.tasks_panel.publish_registration)".</0>

<0>Review the draft before you publish.</0><0>The description of the result (metadata) will become visible to others when you click on "$t(registration.public_page.tasks_panel.publish_registration)".</0><0>Any open files you have uploaded will not be made public until a curator has checked the file version and licence.</0>
tasks_panel.registration_will_soon_be_published: The registration will be published soon. Wait a bit before you reload page to see updated status.
tasks_panel.reject_publishing_request_description_on: <0>If you choose "$t(registration.public_page.reject_publish_request)", the file will not be published and therefore will not be visible to others. The file will be moved to unpublished.</0><0>If you wish to delete the file, do so in the editing of the research result.</0>
tasks_panel.reject_publishing_request_description_ot: <0>If you choose "$t(registration.public_page.reject_publish_request)", the files will not be published and therefore will not be visible to others. The files will be moved to unpublished.</0><0>If you wish to delete the files, do so in the editing of the research result.</0>
tasks_panel.republish_description: Republish the result if it is to be available in NVA.
tasks_panel.request_doi_description: <0>A DOI (Digital Object Identifier) increases the visibility of the research result and can lead to more citations.</0><1><0>Read more about DOI<0></0></0></1><0>If you want a DOI for this result, click on "{{buttonText}}".</0>
tasks_panel.reserve_doi_confirmation: <0>Only published research results can have a DOI.</0><0>If you need a DOI to correctly cite research results in other research results that are in progress, before it is published, you can reserve a DOI.</0><0>Only you can see the reserved DOI, and it does not lead anywhere until you publish the research result. After publication, your curator is informed that you want a DOI, and must then assign it (or reject it).</0><0>If you are ready to publish, then publish, and select "$t(registration.public_page.request_doi)", instead of reserving a DOI.</0><1>Do you still want to reserve a DOI?</1>
tasks_panel.terminate_result_confirmation: <0>All files and most of the metadata are deleted from the result.</0><0>Only metadata that are necessary to cite the research result will be saved. This includes title, contributors, channel information, category, publication date, and persistent identifiers.</0>
tasks_panel.terminate_result_description: <0>Delete the result if it has been incorrectly registered.</0><0>If the result is deleted, it is not possible to restore the information and files associated with the result.</0>
tasks_panel.waiting_for_rejected_doi: It may take some time before a reserved DOI is removed. Reload the page to check again.

registration.registration_doi_validation_message: This result is already published in NVA. If it has errors or omissions, the result must be corrected.
registration.start_with_empty_registration_title: Start in a blank registration form
registration.start_with_link_to_resource_description: Link to the original version if the resource is already published on the Internet
registration.start_with_link_to_resource_title: Start with link to original version
registration.start_with_uploading_file_description: Upload file if the resource is not published on the internet

resource_type.add_related_results_reference: If you cannot find the result, and it will not be registered in NVA, click the button to type in the reference:

artistic.music_score_isrc_helper_text: Consists of 12 alphanumerical signs. Example: NO-6Q7-25-00047
artistic.remove_announcement_description: Are you sure you want to remove "{{name}}" from list of announcements?
artistic.remove_music_work_description: Are you sure you want to remove this work?

resource_type.cannot_select_degree_when_non_degree_has: You cannot select student thesis when there is already an open file uploaded on the result. Delete the file before changing category, if the category is wrong.
resource_type.cannot_select_non_degree_when_degree_has: You cannot select anything other than student theses when there is an open file on the current student thesis. Delete the file before you change category, if the category is wrong.
resource_type.change_registration_type_description: Note that this may result in you losing some data you have entered in cases where existing data is not valid for the new type. Are you sure you want to change the registration type?
resource_type.channel_claimed_by_other_institution: {{channelType}} is owned by a different institution than what you are logged in to.

chapter.info_anthology: The anthology where the chapter is published, must be registered and made public in NVA before you can register the chapter
chapter.info_book_of_abstracts: The abstract collection where the abstract is published must be published first
chapter.info_report: The report where the chapter is published must be published first
chapter.search_for_anthology: Search for the anthology where the chapter is published
chapter.search_for_book_of_abstracts: Search for the book of abstracts where the abstract is published
chapter.search_for_report: Search for the report where the chapter is published

resource_type.click_to_change_resource_type: Click on the selected category to change it
resource_type.duplicate_category_warning: There is already a publication with {{sameFields}} that has been published in this category. If this is the same result that you are trying to register, you must cancel the registration so you do not create duplicates.
resource_type.files_will_be_handled_by_other_instituti: Any files will be processed by curator at "<institution/>".
resource_type.level: Level in the Norwegian Publication Indicator

media_contribution.name_of_issue_episode: Name of issue, episode, etc. (if relevant)
media_contribution.name_of_series_program: Name of series, program, etc. (if relevant)

nvi.applicable: The publication can be included in the Norwegian Science Index
nvi.channel_not_rated: The publication cannot be included in the Norwegian Science Index since the publication channel is not at level 1 or 2. (The level may be changed before the year's reporting deadline so that the publication can be included in the Norwegian Science Index)

resource_type.protected_file_type: Your institution has chosen not to support file upload for this category. Contact curator support if you still wish to add a file.
resource_type.related_results_description: Search for and select results in the search field to link related results to this result
resource_type.remove_link_text: Do you wish to remove the link?

accept_dataset_terms.contains_personal_data: Does the dataset contain personal data?*
accept_dataset_terms.contains_personal_data_description: Personal data is any information about an identified or identifiable individual. This can be a name, address, phone number, email, picture, sound recording, fingerprint, online identifier, location information, etc.
accept_dataset_terms.contains_sensitive_data: Does the dataset contain other sensitive or confidential data?*
accept_dataset_terms.contains_sensitive_data_description: Sensitive or confidential data is information and data that require protection or shielding, and must be secured against unlawful access and intrusion. This can be personal data, trade secrets, security information, commercial rights, patents, etc.
accept_dataset_terms.dialog_title: To add research data you must first declare if
accept_dataset_terms.further_info: When you click YES or are unsure, you must send a message to support where your curator will clarify the further process to publish the dataset.

research_data.external_link_helper_text: Add external link with related content
research_data.external_link_helper_text_error: Invalid URL. Ensure that the link is complete. Example: https://sikt.no
research_data.no_publications_using_dataset: No publications are using the dataset.
research_data.remove_relation_confirm_text: Do you want to remove this relation?
research_data.search_for_related_dmps: Search for related data management plans
research_data.search_for_related_registrations: Search for results using either title or DOI
research_data.search_for_related_registrations_helper: Choose from registrations that are published in NVA

resource_type.search_for_channel: Search the ISSN at <0><0></0></0> to ensure the values you register are correct.
resource_type.series_info: If the publication is part of a series

curator_help.already_in_progress: You already have a dialogue with the curator. Save and go to the result via "$t(my_page.my_page)" to continue the dialogue there.
curator_help.description: <0>You can send a message to the curator at your institution. The message is visible to curators and editors at your institution.</0><0>The curator can help you register and change published results.</0><0>You can find the dialogue with the curator at "$t(my_page.my_page)".</0>
curator_help.header: Do you need help from a curator?

self_help.description: Do you need help? See if you can solve the problem yourself by looking at the user guides.
self_help.header: Guide to register a research result
self_help.institution_help_description: <0>Do you have technical issues?</0><0>See and possibly report errors to user support</0>

registration.use_curator_help_button: Use the "{{buttonText}}" button below if you have questions.

science_categories_front_page:
Work in various categories

Research and dissemination encompass much more than scientific publications.

Everything is registered in different categories, and you can search and look up all the categories below.

search.search_for_responsible_institution: Search for institution responsible for research
search.search_placeholder: Search for title, contributor, abstract, etc.
search.search_project_placeholder: Search for title, project ID, grant ID or participant

search_in_national_research_publication: Search over 2 million publications from researchers at universities, university colleges, and research institutions across the country.

nvi.approve_nvi_candidate_description:
Check of research result for Norwegian Publication Indicator (NVI) reporting.

Press "{{buttonText}}" if the publication can be reported. See the Reporting Instruction for more information.
nvi.approve_rejected_nvi_candidate_descripti: Press "{{buttonText}}" if the publication is to be reported. The reason for the rejection will also be removed.
nvi.delete_note_description: Are you sure you want to delete this comment?
nvi.message_description: If you have relevant information for the check, please add a comment. The comment is visible to other Norwegian Science Index (NVI) curators with editing access.
nvi.no_nvi_candidates: You have no NVI candidates for this search.
nvi.problem_description:
The NVI candidate lacks required information:

  • $t(tasks.nvi.unidentified_person_with_nvi_institution)

Identify the person before approving by editing the result. Control statuses are reset when an unidentified person is identified.
nvi.reject_nvi_candidate_description: Click "{{buttonText}}" if the publication cannot be reported. You must justify the rejection.
nvi.reject_nvi_candidate_modal_text:
Provide an explanation for why you are rejecting the publication for Norwegian Publication Indicator (NVI) reporting.

If you are unsure about the requirements, see the Reporting Instruction.

The explanation will be stored in NVA, and will be visible to NVI curators at the co-publishing institutions.

Provide an explanation for why you are rejecting this publication for reporting. The explanation must contain at least 10 characters.
nvi.reporting_period_closed: The reporting period for this result is closed.
nvi.reporting_period_missing: The reporting period for this result is not open.
nvi.reset_approval_description: Are you sure you want to reset the reporting status? Someone at your institution will then have to report it again.
nvi.unidentified_person_with_nvi_institution: Unidentified person with a connection to an NVI institution

tasks.search_placeholder: Search for title, contributor, abstract or similar

unpublish_actions.confirm_unpublish: I confirm that the information is correct, and that the result should be unpublished.
unpublish_actions.search_duplicate_facets: Search with DOI, handle or title
unpublish_actions.unpublish_info: The result will no longer be visible to others if you choose to unpublish it. It will still be visible to everyone with a direct link. You may choose to republish it later.
unpublish_actions.unpublish_not_allowed: <0>You can not unpublish this result, because it has either an uploaded file with an approved licence or has been reported to the Norwegian science index (NVI).</0><0>Please contact curator support if you need to unpublish.</0>
unpublish_actions.unpublish_registration_detail_1: After unpublishing the result you may no longer search for it, but it is still available via direct links (from citations).
unpublish_actions.unpublish_registration_detail_2: Only metadata (no files) will be visible when directly looked up.
unpublish_actions.unpublish_registration_duplicate_citatio: In order for all citations to be continued, you must look up the other registration. Then all citations will still lead to the other version.
unpublish_actions.unpublish_registration_duplicate_questio: Is there another published version of the same research result?
unpublish_actions.unpublish_registration_reason: Enter a brief explanation for why this research result should no longer be published. The explanation will be displayed on the research result when looking up the reference to the research result.

vocabulary_missing: The institution has not added vocabulary
what_you_find_in_nva_description:
What can you find in NVA?

The Norwegian Research Information Repository (NVA) collects and makes information about Norwegian research accessible.

Here, you can explore publications, research projects, and researchers across universities, university colleges, and research institutions.
you_cannot_upload_files_to_this_result: You do not have access to upload files for this result.
you_do_not_have_permission_to_edit_this_: You do not have access to edit this registration.
